intro: Scabiosa parielii var. pinnatisecta, commonly known as the pinnatisect scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caprifoliaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves that are finely divided, giving it a lacey appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, loamy soil. Scabiosa parielii var. pinnatisecta is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
